text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with another experiment in cooking
with yogurt this is paprika chicken and
it was really good so here's how I put
it together first I made a marinade this
is garlic I had some cloves of garlic
finely crushed and I'm going to put a
little bit of oil now someone asked me
about oil and a marinade and I think you
need a little bit some things are oil
soluble I don't remember which things
but I like some oil to marinate in I'm
also going to put the paprika the start
of the show a couple spoons of that all
right so that's going to be kind of the
base of this marinade I want to put some
cayenne and about a tablespoon of that
sambal which is the Asian crushed red
pepper sauce kind of spicy but not super
spicy and then I'm going to put two big
dollops half a container of plain
non-fat yogurt I don't really miss the
fat for the marinating with yogurt so I
don't know for sauces you probably want
to get the regular yogurt but that was
perfect for the marinade so now I have
one chicken I cut up into 8 pieces the
breast pieces I cut in half and I'm
going to do those skinless because the
skin usually comes off of those anyway
but for the legs and the thighs I'm
going to leave the skin on because I
like a little skin oh shoot I screwed up
a joke I like to see a little skin all
right so we're going to marinate those
we're going to make sure they're all
coated very well I'm going to put some
plastic out and those are going to go in
the fridge for 3 hours all right
a three hour tour of the fridge you're
going to take them out you're going to
wipe off some of the marinade you can
have a little bit on there we're going
to salt that well and then we're going
to go out to the grill which has been
preheated I'm using charcoal alright
there's my beautiful new grill you may
remember that grill from such videos as
grilled yogurt chicken I'm going to put
that down and to prevent flare-ups I
think I mentioned this before to prevent
flare-ups I like to kind of sear it on
that first side with the lid down kind
of slows the flame a little bit
so once I get a nice mark on there I'm
going to turn them over so that's I only
cooked for like three or four minutes
certainly not halfway on one side so
that's kind of breaking a rule but I
like to get a nice color on one side and
then finish the cooking with the lid
closed on the other side
I don't worry about exactly half and
half one side and the other because with
the lid down it's basically like an oven
lit up you're going to have a hotter
flame you're going to have outside
cooking a lot faster than the inside
with the lid down you're still going to
get the nice sear marks but the grill
the inside the grill is going to heat up
to like an oven temperature and you
won't get that really dark outside it'll
cook a little more evenly I think and
there it is I'm going to take it off
unbelievably beautiful that was in the
Sun as I waited for the last couple
pieces to finish cooking they all don't
finish the same time it's that magic
chicken so don't be afraid to take a few
pieces off then while that was resting I
decided to make a paprika red
vinaigrette to put on top I put some
ketchup a little splash of hot sauce now
this was hot hot sauce but that's okay a
little pinch of paprika which was
Spanish get some good paprika not that
brown stuff in the back here covered
real bright red Spanish paprika I put
some black pepper some sherry vinegar
keeping with the Spanish theme and then
some olive oil about twice as much olive
oil as sherry vinegar I whisk that
together and that made kind of a red
vinaigrette that tasted like sherry
vinegar little paprika a little tomato
so what I wanted to do with that just to
moisten up the chicken a little bit the
inside was moist but I want a little bit
of glaze for the outside I just spooned
that over and it was really fun to spoon
this over so these are the little
meditations you do when you cook all
right you tell everyone to get away from
you and you slowly drizzle paprika
vinaigrette over chicken
oh that's relaxing all right so now
that's ready glazed beautiful shiny yeah
I mean look at that you want a piece of
that don't you take a piece come on take
a piece I'm sorry that was kind of mean
it was really good and there it is my
yogurt exploration continues lovin
yogurt marinades so juicy and this one
was just really simple a little bit of
paprika and garlic and not much more to
it than that so check out the site all
the ingredients are there and as always
enjoy
